sk.upjs.gursky.bplustree
Class BPNode<K extends BPKey<K>,O extends BPObject<K,O>>

java.lang.Object
  sk.upjs.gursky.bplustree.BPNode<K,O>
Type Parameters:
K - Key class used in innner nodes
O - Entry class used in leaf nodes
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
BPInnerNode, BPLeafNode
abstract class BPNode<K extends BPKey<K>,O extends BPObject<K,O>>
extends Object
implements Serializable

Abstract class for both node types of the BPTree. This class is not public.

Version:
1.0, February 5th 2009
Author:
Peter Gursky
See Also:
BPTree, BPInnerNode, BPLeafNode, BPKey, BPObject

          place in file, where this node belongs

Constant Field Values

numberOfEntries

int numberOfEntries
number of entries in leaf nodes and keys in inner nodes, number of offsets is + 1

offset

long offset
place in file, where this node belongs

isChanged

boolean isChanged
Tells if the node was changed since last read from disk. This is used in cache to find out if the node need to be rewritten

tree

BPTree<K extends BPKey<K>,O extends BPObject<K,O>> tree
reference to the tree

abstract BPLeafNode<K,O> findLeafLeft()
Returns the most left leaf in the B+tree

Returns:
the most left leaf in the B+tree

findLeafRight

abstract BPLeafNode<K,O> findLeafRight()
Returns the most right leaf in the B+tree

Returns:
the most right leaf in the B+tree

findLeft

abstract BPLeafNode<K,O> findLeft(O entry)
Returns the leaf in the B+tree that contains given entry or if there is no such entry it is the leaf, in which it should be according to inner nodes

Parameters:
entry - Entry to find
Returns:
the leaf in which the entry is or should be

findLeafLeft

abstract BPLeafNode<K,O> findLeafLeft(K key)
Returns the most left leaf in the B+tree that contains entry with the given tree (it is not necessary that keys are unique) or if there is no such entry it is the leaf, in which it should be according to inner nodes

Parameters:
key - Key to find
Returns:
the most left leaf in which the entry with the given key is or should be

add

abstract KeyOffsetPair<K> add(O entry)
Adds a new entry to the tree. If the entry in the tree already exists nothing changes.

Parameters:
entry - Entry to add
Returns:
pair of key and offset after splitting the nodes.

batchUpdate

abstract K batchUpdate(Iterator<O> iterator,
                       int size,
                       int height,
                       ArrayList<Integer> maxSizes,
                       int leftOffsetCorrection,
                       int rightOffsetCorrection)
Method use the iterator to create the subtree of the node.

Parameters:
iterator - data source for the subtree
size - number of entries in the subtree to store
height - height of the node in the future B+tree
maxSizes - maximal number of entries in subtrees of different heights
leftOffsetCorrection - used to compute correct offsets between leaf nodes
rightOffsetCorrection - used to compute correct offsets between leaf nodes
Returns:
left key of the subtree

remove

abstract boolean remove(O entry,
                        boolean amIRoot,
                        int myHeight)
Removes entry from the subtree.

Parameters:
entry - Entry to remove
amIRoot - true if the node is root
myHeight - height of the node
Returns:
true if the entry has been found and erased, false if there has been no such entry in a tree

save

abstract void save(ByteBuffer bb)
Stores the node in the ByteBuffer. Uses the save of the BPKeys or BPObjects.

Parameters:
bb - ByteBuffer to store to.

toString

abstract String toString(String level)
Adds the subtree dump to the String.

Parameters:
level - string to add to
Returns:
result of the addition

getTreeHeight

abstract int getTreeHeight()
Returns the height of the node.

Returns:
the height of the node
